channel.title: Projects on Sarah Shoilee
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Sarah Shoilee

item.title: Knowledge Discovery on Spreadsheet using Semantic Information (Master Thesis)
item.description:
Abstract: For data processing and maintenance, a spreadsheet is the most widely used tools amongst corporations. Performing in-depth research on spreadsheets remains critical to enabling knowledge discovery as well as improving user efficiency and supporting error-free data processing. Further research in this field is essential, considering the sheer expanse and the importance of tabular data in the data community, despite the number of existing works in the area. This thesis proposes an algorithm for tabular constraint learning using semantic header information, focusing on enhancing existing tabular constraint learner (TaCLe). The proposed solution will rediscover lost formulas on a poorly filed spreadsheet while conceptually analysing the header. The proposal of the header interpretation assists to recapture formulas faster with more accuracy than the previous solution , overall improving the computational performance.

Furthermore, this research outlines the usability of header information come along with tabular data, often ignored due to its complex structure. The study further proposes a formula reconstruction application, empirically validating each step of the design decision . This technique will not only b e capable of formula rediscovery but also for formula suggestion, error-correction, and auto-completion in a spreadsheet environment when integrated with a right interaction model.

item.title: Development of digital platform to empower healthy lifestyle
item.description: This project is about designing a habit visualisation and recommendation tool that allows you to better understand your habits. The goal is to improve your health score by changing the most crucial habits for your profile. Start by filling out your profile, then explore your health tree, different habit combinations, and compare yourself to global and cohort averages. This project was in Collaboration with Digital Society School, TNO (Netherlands Organisation for Applied Scientific Research), and Imagination of Things.

item.title: San Francisco Taxi network data analysis using Hadoop and Spark
item.description:
• Trip analysis from fragmented trip segments and revenue generation
  • Technique: Map-reduce framework in both Hadoop and spark environment.
  • Language: Java

item.title: Analysis of different artificial neural network & Deep learning techniques
item.description:
• Experimentation with different setting, hyperparameter tuninig and analyzing the nature of algorithm
  • Technniques: Hopfield Network, Time-series Prediction, RNN, LSTM, PCA, Autoencoders, CNN, Restriced Boltzmann Machines, Deep Boltzmann Machines, GAN
  • Tool: Matlab, Python (Library: Keras, TensorFlow)

item.title: Performance analysis between logistic regression and very large decision tree
item.description:
• Class prediction
  • Logistic Regression & Very Large Decision Tree
  • Language: Java

item.title: Image class prediction and pixel-wise image segmentation
item.description:
• Image class prediction and pixel-wise image segmentation
  • Technique: Auto-encoder, Classifier(VGG-16), Convolutional neural network and convolutional transpose(FC-16)
  • Language: Python
  • Library: Keras, TensorFlow, OpenCV
